revised_title: Spectroscopic Studies of Alkali Metals in 15-Crown-5 Solutions
tldr: This study investigates the nature of solutions containing alkali metals dissolved in the liquid crown ether 15-crown-5 using various spectroscopic techniques. The major paramagnetic species in these solutions are solvated electrons and electron-cation complexes, while the diamagnetic species is the alkali-metal anion. The results provide insights into the properties of these solutions and their potential applications as selective two-electron reducing agents.
